result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Steffen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.
Concurrent with: any current sentence.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Steffen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven A Steffen in court, in custody, with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 30 days jail CONCURRENT with any current sentence
- Court costs waived.
- DNA surcharge waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.

Defendant Steven A Steffen in court, in custody, with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has received discovery from prior counsel today.  Defendant has revocation proceedings scheduled for 3/18/15.  Hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with Beverly N. or her residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Steven A Steffen in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant allowed a free phone call to obtain bail.
  Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
